VIII.iv.3.C.3.a
.
Requirement for Deciding All IU Claims
The Department of Veterans Affairs (VA) must make a decision on IU when the issue is
explicitly raised by the Veteran, or
reasonably raised by the evidence of record.
If IU is raised and the Veteran fails to complete and return
VA Form 21-8940, Veteran’s Application for Increased Compensation Based on Unemployability
, VA must make a decision on the issue of IU in a rating decision based on the available evidence of record, denying entitlement as described in
M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, 3.C.3.d
.
Important
:  When the Board of Veterans’ Appeals (BVA) determines that IU has been reasonably raised by the record and issues a decision granting or remanding IU, the instructions in
M21-5, Chapter 7, Section G, Topic 1.i
provide guidance on completion of
VA Form
VA Form 21-8940
.
title: M21-1, Part VIII, Subpart iv, Chapter 3, Section C - Individual Unemployability (IU) Rating and Decision Review
